syllabus:
**Academic Writing and Oral _Presentation_ Skills for Humanity Disciplines**

Fall 2020

**Instructor**: Miao-Hsia Chang  **E-mail**: [mhchang@ntnu.edu.tw](mailto:mhchang@ntnu.edu.tw)

**Classroom:** Chin Building 301; **Office hours:** Wed. 13:10-15:10; Thur. 14:00-16:00

I. Course Description
=====================

          The primary goal of this class is to enhance students’ development of the academic writing, research methods, and **_presentation_** skills in humanity disciplines. Students will develop the English reading and writing skills necessary to comprehend and produce journal articles or theses/dissertations in their specialized field. Students will also discuss and develop the skills they will need to present their research in a seminar or at an international conference.

**II. Textbook**

Swales, John M. & Christine B. Feak. 3rd ed. 2012.  _Academic Writing for Graduate Students: Essential Tasks and Skills_ (AWGS).  Ann Arbor: The University of Michigan Press. (Available at Crane (文鶴), 8F, 200, Sec. 2, Jinshan S. Road, Daan District, Taipei 106)
=====================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

**III. Requirements and Grading Policy:**
